rows.label: tev900291_MSG0010
rows.name:
Hi, you!
Just the person I was hoping to see.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0020
rows.name:
So, for my Earth culture research,
I commissioned someone to salvage some
data from a piece of the Lifehold for me.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0030
rows.name:
And in that data, I found an absolutely
fascinating concept: a little thing you
call a "novel"![ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0040
rows.name:
Isn't it just so creative? I mean, fabricated
stories, read for entertainment! What kind
of mad genius came up with that?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0050
rows.name:
Anyway, I thought of reading one for
myself, but there's just so much more
data than I'd thought possible...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0060
rows.name:
They're all categorized based on
something called "genre"...
Say, which genre do you like best?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_JNK0070
rows.name: Recommend Sci-Fi

rows.label: tev900291_SEL0080
rows.name:
Suggest that she could start with
a science-fiction novel.

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0090
rows.name:
A science-fiction novel, hm?
According to the data, that's...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0100
rows.name:
A work of fiction of relative complexity,
depicting advanced technology, space
travel, extraterrestrial life, etc.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0110
rows.name: Yes, I see. How interesting...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0120
rows.name:
...No, hang on.
Am I reading this right?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0130
rows.name:
That doesn't sound very original at all!
Wouldn't that fall under contemporary
writing?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0140
rows.name:
Err, though I suppose it's not the case
for humans, is it? This might be a good
way to see the universe from your eyes...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_JNK0150
rows.name: Recommend a Thriller

rows.label: tev900291_SEL0160
rows.name:
Propose she begin her foray with
a hard-boiled page-turner.

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0170
rows.name:
A detective thriller, hm...?
According to the data, that's...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0180
rows.name:
A work of fiction centered on discerning
the identity of a murderer, thief, or other
criminal, by investigating clues they left...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0190
rows.name: ...I see.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0200
rows.name:
So it's a philosophical kind of text,
interested in investigating the notion
of crime, and by extension, sin...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0210
rows.name:
The definition of a sin differs greatly
between civilizations, and can be very
revealing... This could prove fascinating.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_JNK0220
rows.name: Recommend YA Novels

rows.label: tev900291_SEL0230
rows.name:
Mention that she could start with
a few young-adult novels.

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0240
rows.name:
Hmm? I've never heard of those!
Let's seeâ€”according to the data,
they're...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0250
rows.name:
A body of epic poetry about being reborn
in another world and given divine powers
to thwart villains and build paradise.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0260
rows.name:
...Er? Reborn in another world?
As in, reincarnation?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0270
rows.name:
And what's this about divine powers...?
Do humans really believe in a god that
dispenses superpowers like candy?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0280
rows.name:
This... This is a lot to take in.
I don't know I'll be able to understand,
but if it's what humans like...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900291_MSG0290
rows.name:
Well, in any case, thank you for the
advice. I can see I've got a long road
ahead of me...[ST:wait ]
